item.title: Help with client
item.dc:creator: @Mupescape Mupescape
item.description:
@Mupescape wrote:

Not enough info but I guess it would help
1- go to Class30_Sub2_Sub1_Sub1.java
2- hit Ctrl + F and seach for Toolkit.getDefaultToolkit().createImage
3- usually the picture should be in the cache folder If it is it would look like

("cache/WHATEVER.jpg"); ( I just typed “WHATEVER” because I dont know what the name of the image would be called.) or…
you can just upload the image to photobucket and use the DIRECT LINK and put that where I typed before…
so it would look like this example: code; [/code]
(Don’t copy that code unless you want your client backround to look like mine.
4- The Image should be 765 x 504 and it should look like this be sure to split the image in half
(I’ll preview a picture of my client backround)
PREVIEW:

Mupescape_1.jpg765×504

(I’ve just kind of messed the picture of when I split it in half.)
5-once your done with your client backround compile and close the folder and open it back up again.
There you go! Hope this helped!

Read full topic
